step_data.thought:
I've successfully generated a Sales Orders report for the period from March 1, 2025, to April 1, 2025. Looking at the current page, I can see that the report now shows '1 records found' and displays data in the table. The report shows one order from March 31, 2025, with the following details:

- Orders: 1
- Sales Items: 2
- Sales Total: USD56.24
- Invoiced: USD0.00
- Refunded: USD0.00
- Sales Tax: USD0.00
- Sales Shipping: USD10.00
- Sales Discount: USD11.56
- Canceled: USD0.00

The report is now fully displayed and I can see the order trends and performance data. I can also see that there's an option to export this data to CSV or Excel XML if needed. The goal of viewing Sales Orders reports to analyze order trends and performance has been accomplished. I should now send a message to the user summarizing what I've found.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully accessed and generated the Sales Orders report for the period from March 1, 2025, to April 1, 2025. The report shows 1 order placed on March 31, 2025, with a total value of USD56.24. The order contained 2 items, included USD10.00 in shipping charges, and had a discount of USD11.56 applied. No invoices have been generated yet, and there were no refunds or cancellations. This data provides insight into recent order performance. You can also export this report to CSV or Excel XML format using the export options at the bottom of the page.')
